    Let us compute the absolute value between the transformations of those two functions and see what happens :

    |𝒯vπ⁢u⁢(s)−𝒯vπ⁢u⁢(s)|subscriptsuperscript𝒯𝜋𝑣𝑢𝑠subscriptsuperscript𝒯𝜋𝑣𝑢𝑠\displaystyle\left|\mathcal{T}^{\pi}_{v}u(s)-\mathcal{T}^{\pi}_{v}u(s)\right|| caligraphic_T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_u ( italic_s ) - caligraphic_T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_u ( italic_s ) | =|∑aπ(a|s)⋅(γ⋅∑s′p(s′|s,a)u(s′)−γ⋅∑s′p(s′|s,a)v(s′))|\displaystyle=\left|\sum_{a}\pi(a|s)\cdot\left(\gamma\cdot\sum_{s^{\prime}}p(s% ^{\prime}|s,a)u(s^{\prime})-\gamma\cdot\sum_{s^{\prime}}p(s^{\prime}|s,a)v(s^{% \prime})\right)\right|= | ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π ( italic_a | italic_s ) ⋅ ( italic_γ ⋅ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s , italic_a ) italic_u ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) - italic_γ ⋅ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s , italic_a ) italic_v ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) |
    =γ⋅|∑aπ(a|s)⋅(∑s′p(s′|s,a)u(s′)−∑s′p(s′|s,a)v(s′))|\displaystyle=\gamma\cdot\left|\sum_{a}\pi(a|s)\cdot\left(\sum_{s^{\prime}}p(s% ^{\prime}|s,a)u(s^{\prime})-\sum_{s^{\prime}}p(s^{\prime}|s,a)v(s^{\prime})% \right)\right|= italic_γ ⋅ | ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π ( italic_a | italic_s ) ⋅ ( ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s , italic_a ) italic_u ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) - ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s , italic_a ) italic_v ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) |
    =γ⋅|∑aπ(a|s)⋅(𝔼s′|s,au(s′)−𝔼s′|s,av(s′))|\displaystyle=\gamma\cdot\left|\sum_{a}\pi(a|s)\cdot\left(\mathbb{E}_{s^{% \prime}|s,a}u(s^{\prime})-\mathbb{E}_{s^{\prime}|s,a}v(s^{\prime})\right)\right|= italic_γ ⋅ | ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π ( italic_a | italic_s ) ⋅ ( blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s , italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_u ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) - blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s , italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) |
    ≤γ⋅maxs′⁢|u⁢(s′)−v⁢(s′)|absent⋅𝛾superscript𝑠′𝑢superscript𝑠′𝑣superscript𝑠′\displaystyle\leq\gamma\cdot\underset{s^{\prime}}{\max}\left|u(s^{\prime})-v(s% ^{\prime})\right|≤ italic_γ ⋅ start_UNDERACCENT italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_UNDERACCENT start_ARG roman_max end_ARG | italic_u ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) - italic_v ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) |
    ⇒|𝒯vπ⁢u⁢(s)−𝒯vπ⁢u⁢(s)|⇒absentsubscriptsuperscript𝒯𝜋𝑣𝑢𝑠subscriptsuperscript𝒯𝜋𝑣𝑢𝑠\displaystyle\Rightarrow\left|\mathcal{T}^{\pi}_{v}u(s)-\mathcal{T}^{\pi}_{v}u% (s)\right|⇒ | caligraphic_T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_u ( italic_s ) - caligraphic_T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_u ( italic_s ) | ≤γ⋅max𝑠⁢|u⁢(s)−v⁢(s)|absent⋅𝛾𝑠𝑢𝑠𝑣𝑠\displaystyle\leq\gamma\cdot\underset{s}{\max}\left|u(s)-v(s)\right|≤ italic_γ ⋅ underitalic_s start_ARG roman_max end_ARG | italic_u ( italic_s ) - italic_v ( italic_s ) |
    ⇒max𝑠⁢|𝒯vπ⁢u⁢(s)−𝒯vπ⁢u⁢(s)|⇒absent𝑠subscriptsuperscript𝒯𝜋𝑣𝑢𝑠subscriptsuperscript𝒯𝜋𝑣𝑢𝑠\displaystyle\Rightarrow\underset{s}{\max}\left|\mathcal{T}^{\pi}_{v}u(s)-% \mathcal{T}^{\pi}_{v}u(s)\right|⇒ underitalic_s start_ARG roman_max end_ARG | caligraphic_T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_u ( italic_s ) - caligraphic_T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_u ( italic_s ) | ≤γ⋅‖u⁢(s)−v⁢(s)‖∞absent⋅𝛾subscriptnorm𝑢𝑠𝑣𝑠\displaystyle\leq\gamma\cdot||u(s)-v(s)||_{\infty}≤ italic_γ ⋅ | | italic_u ( italic_s ) - italic_v ( italic_s ) | | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∞ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT
    ⇒‖𝒯vπ⁢u⁢(s)−𝒯vπ⁢u⁢(s)‖∞⇒absentsubscriptnormsubscriptsuperscript𝒯𝜋𝑣𝑢𝑠subscriptsuperscript𝒯𝜋𝑣𝑢𝑠\displaystyle\Rightarrow||\mathcal{T}^{\pi}_{v}u(s)-\mathcal{T}^{\pi}_{v}u(s)|% |_{\infty}⇒ | | caligraphic_T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_u ( italic_s ) - caligraphic_T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_u ( italic_s ) | | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∞ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤γ⋅‖u⁢(s)−v⁢(s)‖∞absent⋅𝛾subscriptnorm𝑢𝑠𝑣𝑠\displaystyle\leq\gamma\cdot||u(s)-v(s)||_{\infty}≤ italic_γ ⋅ | | italic_u ( italic_s ) - italic_v ( italic_s ) | | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∞ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT (4.3.2)

    This proves that the Bellman Expectation Operator for the state value function is a contraction mapping.

  2. 2.

    Let us now prove the monotonicity :
    Assume that u⁢(s)≤v⁢(s)𝑢𝑠𝑣𝑠u(s)\leq v(s)italic_u ( italic_s ) ≤ italic_v ( italic_s ) in all states, then we will get :

    𝒯vπ⁢u⁢(s)−𝒯vπ⁢v⁢(s)subscriptsuperscript𝒯𝜋𝑣𝑢𝑠subscriptsuperscript𝒯𝜋𝑣𝑣𝑠\displaystyle\mathcal{T}^{\pi}_{v}u(s)-\mathcal{T}^{\pi}_{v}v(s)caligraphic_T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_u ( italic_s ) - caligraphic_T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v ( italic_s ) =γ⋅∑aπ⁢(a|s)⋅(𝔼s′|s,a⁢u⁢(s′)−𝔼s′|s,a⁢v⁢(s′))absent⋅𝛾subscript𝑎⋅𝜋conditional𝑎𝑠subscript𝔼conditionalsuperscript𝑠′𝑠𝑎𝑢superscript𝑠′subscript𝔼conditionalsuperscript𝑠′𝑠𝑎𝑣superscript𝑠′\displaystyle=\gamma\cdot\sum_{a}\pi(a|s)\cdot\left(\mathbb{E}_{s^{\prime}|s,a% }u(s^{\prime})-\mathbb{E}_{s^{\prime}|s,a}v(s^{\prime})\right)= italic_γ ⋅ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π ( italic_a | italic_s ) ⋅ ( blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s , italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_u ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) - blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s , italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) )
    =γ⋅∑aπ⁢(a|s)⋅(𝔼s′|s,a⁢(u⁢(s′)−v⁢(s′))⏟u⁢(s)≤v⁢(s)⁢∀s)absent⋅𝛾subscript𝑎⋅𝜋conditional𝑎𝑠subscript𝔼conditionalsuperscript𝑠′𝑠𝑎𝑢𝑠𝑣𝑠for-all𝑠⏟𝑢superscript𝑠′𝑣superscript𝑠′\displaystyle=\gamma\cdot\sum_{a}\pi(a|s)\cdot\left(\mathbb{E}_{s^{\prime}|s,a% }\underset{u(s)\leq v(s)~{}\forall s}{\underbrace{\left(u(s^{\prime})-v(s^{% \prime})\right)}}\right)= italic_γ ⋅ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π ( italic_a | italic_s ) ⋅ ( blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s , italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_UNDERACCENT italic_u ( italic_s ) ≤ italic_v ( italic_s ) ∀ italic_s end_UNDERACCENT start_ARG under⏟ start_ARG ( italic_u ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) - italic_v ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) end_ARG end_ARG )
    =γ⋅∑aπ⁢(a|s)⋅(𝔼s′|s,a⁢(u⁢(s′)−v⁢(s′)))≤0absent⋅𝛾subscript𝑎⋅𝜋conditional𝑎𝑠subscript𝔼conditionalsuperscript𝑠′𝑠𝑎𝑢superscript𝑠′𝑣superscript𝑠′0\displaystyle=\gamma\cdot\sum_{a}\pi(a|s)\cdot\left(\mathbb{E}_{s^{\prime}|s,a% }\left(u(s^{\prime})-v(s^{\prime})\right)\right)\leq 0= italic_γ ⋅ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π ( italic_a | italic_s ) ⋅ ( blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s , italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_u ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) - italic_v ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) ) ≤ 0
    ⇒𝒯vπ⁢u⁢(s)−𝒯vπ⁢v⁢(s)⇒absentsubscriptsuperscript𝒯𝜋𝑣𝑢𝑠subscriptsuperscript𝒯𝜋𝑣𝑣𝑠\displaystyle\Rightarrow\mathcal{T}^{\pi}_{v}u(s)-\mathcal{T}^{\pi}_{v}v(s)⇒ caligraphic_T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_u ( italic_s ) - caligraphic_T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v ( italic_s ) ≤0absent0\displaystyle\leq 0≤ 0
    ⇒𝒯vπ⁢u⁢(s)⇒absentsubscriptsuperscript𝒯𝜋𝑣𝑢𝑠\displaystyle\Rightarrow\mathcal{T}^{\pi}_{v}u(s)⇒ caligraphic_T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_u ( italic_s ) ≤𝒯vπ⁢v⁢(s)⁢i.e. 𝒯vπ is a monotonic mappingabsentsubscriptsuperscript𝒯𝜋𝑣𝑣𝑠i.e. 𝒯vπ is a monotonic mapping\displaystyle\leq\mathcal{T}^{\pi}_{v}v(s)~{}~{}~{}\text{i.e. $\mathcal{T}^{% \pi}_{v}$ is a monotonic mapping}≤ caligraphic_T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v ( italic_s ) i.e. caligraphic_T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is a monotonic mapping (4.3.3)

∎

From the properties we’ve just proven, using the Banach Contraction Principle as refined in the Proposition 4.1.3, we can conclude that :

  • •

    𝒯vπsubscriptsuperscript𝒯𝜋𝑣\mathcal{T}^{\pi}_{v}caligraphic_T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT has a unique fixed point fπ∈𝒱superscript𝑓𝜋𝒱f^{\pi}\in\mathcal{V}italic_f start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∈ caligraphic_V.

  • •

    For any starting point f0subscript𝑓0f_{0}italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, we can find the fixed point fπsuperscript𝑓𝜋f^{\pi}italic_f start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT by looking for the convergence of the sequence defined by fn+1π=𝒯⁢fnπsuperscriptsubscript𝑓𝑛1𝜋𝒯superscriptsubscript𝑓𝑛𝜋f_{n+1}^{\pi}=\mathcal{T}f_{n}^{\pi}italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = caligraphic_T italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT.

This fixed point fπsuperscript𝑓𝜋f^{\pi}italic_f start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is the optimal value function with respect to the policy π𝜋\piitalic_π we are following.

4.3.2 Remark.

For the action value function, the Bellman Expectation Operator 𝒯Qπsubscriptsuperscript𝒯𝜋𝑄\mathcal{T}^{\pi}_{Q}caligraphic_T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and the Bellman Optimality Operator 𝒯Q∗subscriptsuperscript𝒯𝑄\mathcal{T}^{*}_{Q}caligraphic_T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT as defined by the Expression 4.2.5 have exactly the same properties.
Note also that, the Bellman Expectation Operator, by analogy with the formula 3.1.16 is given by :

(𝒯Qπ⁢f)⁢(s,a)=r⁢(s,a)+γ⋅∑s′p⁢(s′|s,a)⁢(∑a′π⁢(a′|s′)⋅f⁢(s′,a′))subscriptsuperscript𝒯𝜋𝑄𝑓𝑠𝑎𝑟𝑠𝑎⋅𝛾subscriptsuperscript𝑠′𝑝conditionalsuperscript𝑠′𝑠𝑎subscriptsuperscript𝑎′⋅𝜋conditionalsuperscript𝑎′superscript𝑠′𝑓superscript𝑠′superscript𝑎′\left(\mathcal{T}^{\pi}_{Q}f\right)(s,a)=r(s,a)+\gamma\cdot\sum_{s^{\prime}}p(% s^{\prime}|s,a)\left(\sum_{a^{\prime}}\pi(a^{\prime}|s^{\prime})\cdot f(s^{% \prime},a^{\prime})\right)( caligraphic_T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f ) ( italic_s , italic_a ) = italic_r ( italic_s , italic_a ) + italic_γ ⋅ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s , italic_a ) ( ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π ( italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ⋅ italic_f ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) (4.3.4)

Here we have presented in a condensed way, the Bellman Operators. Now, we are able to say precisely how the Reinforcement Learning algorithms work really. This is why, in the following section, we are talking about the policy evaluation and policy iteration methods but now in the operator setting and knowing all the properties of those operators, it shows us why the RL algorithm come to work.

4.4 Policy evaluation and iteration in operators setting

From these properties (of the Bellman Operator), we can now deduce two ways of searching for the state-value function and the best policy. There are the well-known foundational policy evaluation and policy improvement (but this last one will be illustrated through policy iteration) algorithms (as presented in the previous chapter) :

  1. 1.

    Policy evaluation :
    The policy evaluation, is a method used to find the true state-value function associated to an MDP while following a specific policy. It’s based on the properties of the Bellman operator. Starting from a random distribution of value functions, until reaching the true one as follows :

    • •

      Start with v0subscript𝑣0v_{0}italic_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT a random initial value function

    • •

      Update the value function using : vk+1←Tπ⁢vk←subscript𝑣𝑘1superscript𝑇𝜋subscript𝑣𝑘v_{k+1}\leftarrow T^{\pi}v_{k}italic_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ← italic_T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT

    By the Banach Fixed-point Principle, it will converge to vπsubscript𝑣𝜋v_{\pi}italic_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT as k→∞→𝑘k\rightarrow\inftyitalic_k → ∞

  2. 2.

    Policy iteration :
    The policy iteration algorithm is used to find the best policy, by updating concurrently the policy (policy improvement) as well as the associated value-functions. It is done in the following way :

    • •

      Start with a random policy π0subscript𝜋0\pi_{0}italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT

    • •

      Concurrent iterations :

      • *

        Policy evaluation : vk+1←Tπi⁢vk←subscript𝑣𝑘1superscript𝑇subscript𝜋𝑖subscript𝑣𝑘v_{k+1}\leftarrow T^{\pi_{i}}v_{k}italic_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ← italic_T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT

      • *

        Policy improvement : Greedily improve the policy using : πi+1=a⁢r⁢g⁢m⁢a⁢xa∈𝒜⁢(s)⁢qπi⁢(s,a)subscript𝜋𝑖1𝑎𝒜𝑠𝑎𝑟𝑔𝑚𝑎𝑥subscript𝑞subscript𝜋𝑖𝑠𝑎\pi_{i+1}=\underset{a\in\mathcal{A}(s)}{argmax~{}}q_{\pi_{i}}(s,a)italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = start_UNDERACCENT italic_a ∈ caligraphic_A ( italic_s ) end_UNDERACCENT start_ARG italic_a italic_r italic_g italic_m italic_a italic_x end_ARG italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_a )

    Again, using the Banach Fixed-point Principle, it will converge to the best policy π𝜋\piitalic_π and the associated value function vπsubscript𝑣𝜋v_{\pi}italic_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT as k→∞→𝑘k\rightarrow\inftyitalic_k → ∞.

This is sufficient to justify how Reinforcement Learning algorithms work because it explains how the two foundational methods work.

Chapter Conclusion

In this chapter we have talked about Bellman operators. We first presented the Bellman optimality operators (for both the state and the state-action value functions), before presenting a general formulation via the Bellman expectation operators (again for both the state and the state-action value functions). We have shown that these operators are γ−limit-from𝛾\gamma-italic_γ -contraction and monotonic mappings, i.e. they have only one fixed point and that fixed point is the optimum. This is very important because it justifies why and how RL algorithms work from a fundamental point of view. In the next chapter we will now discuss some limitations of the Bellman operators in their classical expression and show some alternatives that seem interesting, even if they require further investments.

Chapter 5 Contributions, implementations and analysis

In this chapter we discuss some limitations of the classical Bellman operators as introduced in the previous chapter. We present how we have to make a trade-off between optimality and efficiency, and finally we show some practical results that we have obtained through experiments, which suggest that we need to think more about some refinements that should be made either to the Bellman operators or to the associated value functions.

5.1 Alternatives to the Bellman Operator

As we have seen, value-based reinforcement learning algorithms solve decision making problems through iterative application of a convergent operator, and an initial value function is recursively improved. Many other research works have examined alternatives to the Bellman operator [4, 6, 8, 11, 23, 42], but there are two which seem to be more promising, this is the reason why we will take inspiration from them. The first one is the consistent Bellman Operator [8], and the second one is the family of Robust Stochastic Operators [23]. These two operators appear to be more interesting than those suggested before [23], but for the second, we’ll suggest a refinement of it which will remain good (we postulate) even without the stochasticity, improving the stability.

5.1.1 Motivation [8, 23]

The motivation for new expressions of the Bellman Operator is simple. While Q-learning based methods continue to be successfully used in RL to determine the optimal policy, there is always a need to improve the convergence speed, accuracy and robustness of these algorithms. Now considering the fact that most of the time there are intrinsic error approximation (for example in the usual case of using discrete MDP to approximate a continuous system), the optimal state-action value function obtained through the Bellman operator does not always describe the value of stationary policies. And most importantly, when the differences between the optimal state-action value function and the suboptimal state-action value functions are small, this can lead to errors in identifying the true optimal actions. This is why, even if the classical Bellman Operators can solve problems in a perfect discrete setting, we need to refine it to be general because we know that for many real-world problems of our interest, discrete-time systems come from approximating continuous systems. So, there is always an intrinsic error, thus a need to integrate the corrector in the Operator.
Let us now study the effectiveness of the two aforementioned operators and find some insights on the general method of determining optimal policies in RL.

5.1.2 The Consistent Bellman Operator

This operator, is primarily defined by the authors of [8] for the action-value function. Here is the definition :

𝒯c⁢f⁢(s,a)=r⁢(s,a)+γ⋅∑s′p⁢(s′|s,a)⋅[𝕀{s≠s′}⁢maxa′⁢f⁢(s′,a′)+𝕀{s=s′}⁢f⁢(s,a)]⁢with f∈𝒬subscript𝒯𝑐𝑓𝑠𝑎𝑟𝑠𝑎⋅𝛾subscriptsuperscript𝑠′⋅𝑝conditionalsuperscript𝑠′𝑠𝑎delimited-[]subscript𝕀𝑠superscript𝑠′superscript𝑎′𝑓superscript𝑠′superscript𝑎′subscript𝕀𝑠superscript𝑠′𝑓𝑠𝑎with f∈𝒬\mathcal{T}_{c}f(s,a)=r(s,a)+\gamma\cdot\sum_{s^{\prime}}p(s^{\prime}|s,a)% \cdot\left[\mathbb{I}_{\{s\neq s^{\prime}\}}\underset{a^{\prime}}{\max}~{}f(s^% {\prime},a^{\prime})+\mathbb{I}_{\{s=s^{\prime}\}}f(s,a)\right]~{}~{}~{}\text{% with $f\in\mathcal{Q}$}caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f ( italic_s , italic_a ) = italic_r ( italic_s , italic_a ) + italic_γ ⋅ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s , italic_a ) ⋅ [ blackboard_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT { italic_s ≠ italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT } end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_UNDERACCENT italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_UNDERACCENT start_ARG roman_max end_ARG italic_f ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) + blackboard_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT { italic_s = italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT } end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f ( italic_s , italic_a ) ] with italic_f ∈ caligraphic_Q (5.1.1)

Knowing that 𝕀𝕀\mathbb{I}blackboard_I is the indicator function, we claim also that, the following properties holds for the consistent Bellman Operator given by the Expression 5.1.1 :

  1. 1.

    𝒯csubscript𝒯𝑐\mathcal{T}_{c}caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is a contraction mapping,

  2. 2.

    𝒯csubscript𝒯𝑐\mathcal{T}_{c}caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is monotonic.

Proof.

First, let’s do some refinements :

  • •

    We will replace for simplicity

    ∑s′p⁢(s′|s,a)⋅(f)⁢ by ⁢𝔼ℙ⁢(f)subscriptsuperscript𝑠′⋅𝑝conditionalsuperscript𝑠′𝑠𝑎𝑓 by subscript𝔼ℙ𝑓\sum_{s^{\prime}}p(s^{\prime}|s,a)\cdot(f)\text{~{}~{}~{}~{}by~{}~{}~{}~{}}% \mathbb{E}_{\mathbb{P}}(f)∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s , italic_a ) ⋅ ( italic_f ) by blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_f )
  • •

    We will refine the action-value function as follows :

    fs⁢(s′,a′)={f⁢(s′,a′)ifs≠s′f⁢(s,a)ifs=s′⁢for⁢f∈𝒬subscript𝑓𝑠superscript𝑠′superscript𝑎′cases𝑓superscript𝑠′superscript𝑎′if𝑠superscript𝑠′𝑓𝑠𝑎if𝑠superscript𝑠′for𝑓𝒬f_{s}(s^{\prime},a^{\prime})=\left\{\begin{array}[]{lcl}f(s^{\prime},a^{\prime% })&\text{if}&s\neq s^{\prime}\\ f(s,a)&\text{if}&s=s^{\prime}\\ \end{array}~{}~{}~{}\text{for}~{}~{}~{}f\in\mathcal{Q}\right.italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) = { start_ARRAY start_ROW start_CELL italic_f ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_CELL start_CELL if end_CELL start_CELL italic_s ≠ italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL italic_f ( italic_s , italic_a ) end_CELL start_CELL if end_CELL start_CELL italic_s = italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_CELL end_ROW end_ARRAY for italic_f ∈ caligraphic_Q (5.1.2)

Now we can rewrite the consistent operator in 5.1.1 as follows :

𝒯c⁢f⁢(s,a)=r⁢(s,a)+γ⋅𝔼ℙ⁢[maxa′⁡fs⁢(s′,a′)]⁢with f∈𝒬subscript𝒯𝑐𝑓𝑠𝑎𝑟𝑠𝑎⋅𝛾subscript𝔼ℙdelimited-[]subscriptsuperscript𝑎′subscript𝑓𝑠superscript𝑠′superscript𝑎′with f∈𝒬\mathcal{T}_{c}f(s,a)=r(s,a)+\gamma\cdot\mathbb{E}_{\mathbb{P}}\left[\max_{a^{% \prime}}~{}f_{s}(s^{\prime},a^{\prime})\right]~{}~{}~{}\text{with $f\in% \mathcal{Q}$}caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f ( italic_s , italic_a ) = italic_r ( italic_s , italic_a ) + italic_γ ⋅ blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ] with italic_f ∈ caligraphic_Q (5.1.3)

We can now start the proof :

  1. 1.

    Let u,v∈𝒬𝑢𝑣𝒬u,v\in\mathcal{Q}italic_u , italic_v ∈ caligraphic_Q, we will have :

    |𝒯c⁢u⁢(s,a)−𝒯c⁢v⁢(s,a)|subscript𝒯𝑐𝑢𝑠𝑎subscript𝒯𝑐𝑣𝑠𝑎\displaystyle\left|\mathcal{T}_{c}u(s,a)-\mathcal{T}_{c}v(s,a)\right|| caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_u ( italic_s , italic_a ) - caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v ( italic_s , italic_a ) | =|γ⋅𝔼ℙ⁢(maxa′⁢us⁢(s′,a′))−γ⋅𝔼ℙ⁢(maxb′⁢vs⁢(s′,b′))|absent⋅𝛾subscript𝔼ℙsuperscript𝑎′subscript𝑢𝑠superscript𝑠′superscript𝑎′⋅𝛾subscript𝔼ℙsuperscript𝑏′subscript𝑣𝑠superscript𝑠′superscript𝑏′\displaystyle=\left|\gamma\cdot\mathbb{E}_{\mathbb{P}}\left(\underset{a^{% \prime}}{\max}~{}u_{s}(s^{\prime},a^{\prime})\right)-\gamma\cdot\mathbb{E}_{% \mathbb{P}}\left(\underset{b^{\prime}}{\max}~{}v_{s}(s^{\prime},b^{\prime})% \right)\right|= | italic_γ ⋅ blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( start_UNDERACCENT italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_UNDERACCENT start_ARG roman_max end_ARG italic_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) - italic_γ ⋅ blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( start_UNDERACCENT italic_b start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_UNDERACCENT start_ARG roman_max end_ARG italic_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_b start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) |
    =γ⋅|𝔼ℙ⁢(maxa′⁢us⁢(s′,a′))−𝔼ℙ⁢(maxa′⁢vs⁢(s′,a′))|absent⋅𝛾subscript𝔼ℙsuperscript𝑎′subscript𝑢𝑠superscript𝑠′superscript𝑎′subscript𝔼ℙsuperscript𝑎′subscript𝑣𝑠superscript𝑠′superscript𝑎′\displaystyle=\gamma\cdot\left|\mathbb{E}_{\mathbb{P}}\left(\underset{a^{% \prime}}{\max}~{}u_{s}(s^{\prime},a^{\prime})\right)-\mathbb{E}_{\mathbb{P}}% \left(\underset{a^{\prime}}{\max}~{}v_{s}(s^{\prime},a^{\prime})\right)\right|= italic_γ ⋅ | blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( start_UNDERACCENT italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_UNDERACCENT start_ARG roman_max end_ARG italic_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) - blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( start_UNDERACCENT italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_UNDERACCENT start_ARG roman_max end_ARG italic_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) |
    ≤γ⋅|maxa′⁢𝔼ℙ⁢(us⁢(s′,a′)−vs⁢(s′,a′))|absent⋅𝛾superscript𝑎′subscript𝔼ℙsubscript𝑢𝑠superscript𝑠′superscript𝑎′subscript𝑣𝑠superscript𝑠′superscript𝑎′\displaystyle\leq\gamma\cdot\left|\underset{a^{\prime}}{\max}~{}\mathbb{E}_{% \mathbb{P}}\left(u_{s}(s^{\prime},a^{\prime})-v_{s}(s^{\prime},a^{\prime})% \right)\right|≤ italic_γ ⋅ | start_UNDERACCENT italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_UNDERACCENT start_ARG roman_max end_ARG blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) - italic_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) |
    ≤γ⋅maxa′⁢|𝔼ℙ⁢(us⁢(s′,a′)−vs⁢(s′,a′))|absent⋅𝛾superscript𝑎′subscript𝔼ℙsubscript𝑢𝑠superscript𝑠′superscript𝑎′subscript𝑣𝑠superscript𝑠′superscript𝑎′\displaystyle\leq\gamma\cdot\underset{a^{\prime}}{\max}~{}\left|\mathbb{E}_{% \mathbb{P}}\left(u_{s}(s^{\prime},a^{\prime})-v_{s}(s^{\prime},a^{\prime})% \right)\right|≤ italic_γ ⋅ start_UNDERACCENT italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_UNDERACCENT start_ARG roman_max end_ARG | blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) - italic_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) |
    ≤γ⋅maxs′,a′⁢|us⁢(s′,a′)−vs⁢(s′,a′)|absent⋅𝛾superscript𝑠′superscript𝑎′subscript𝑢𝑠superscript𝑠′superscript𝑎′subscript𝑣𝑠superscript𝑠′superscript𝑎′\displaystyle\leq\gamma\cdot\underset{s^{\prime},a^{\prime}}{\max}~{}\left|u_{% s}(s^{\prime},a^{\prime})-v_{s}(s^{\prime},a^{\prime})\right|≤ italic_γ ⋅ start_UNDERACCENT italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_UNDERACCENT start_ARG roman_max end_ARG | italic_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) - italic_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) |
    =γ⋅maxs,a⁢|us⁢(s,a)−vs⁢(s,a)|absent⋅𝛾𝑠𝑎subscript𝑢𝑠𝑠𝑎subscript𝑣𝑠𝑠𝑎\displaystyle=\gamma\cdot\underset{s,a}{\max}~{}\left|u_{s}(s,a)-v_{s}(s,a)\right|= italic_γ ⋅ start_UNDERACCENT italic_s , italic_a end_UNDERACCENT start_ARG roman_max end_ARG | italic_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_a ) - italic_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_a ) |
    =γ⋅‖us⁢(s,a)−vs⁢(s,a)‖∞absent⋅𝛾subscriptnormsubscript𝑢𝑠𝑠𝑎subscript𝑣𝑠𝑠𝑎\displaystyle=\gamma\cdot||u_{s}(s,a)-v_{s}(s,a)||_{\infty}= italic_γ ⋅ | | italic_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_a ) - italic_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_a ) | | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∞ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT
    ⇒|𝒯c⁢u⁢(s,a)−𝒯c⁢v⁢(s,a)|⇒absentsubscript𝒯𝑐𝑢𝑠𝑎subscript𝒯𝑐𝑣𝑠𝑎\displaystyle\Rightarrow\left|\mathcal{T}_{c}u(s,a)-\mathcal{T}_{c}v(s,a)\right|⇒ | caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_u ( italic_s , italic_a ) - caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v ( italic_s , italic_a ) | ≤γ⋅‖us⁢(s,a)−vs⁢(s,a)‖∞absent⋅𝛾subscriptnormsubscript𝑢𝑠𝑠𝑎subscript𝑣𝑠𝑠𝑎\displaystyle\leq\gamma\cdot||u_{s}(s,a)-v_{s}(s,a)||_{\infty}≤ italic_γ ⋅ | | italic_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_a ) - italic_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_a ) | | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∞ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT
    ⇒‖𝒯c⁢u⁢(s,a)−𝒯c⁢v⁢(s,a)‖∞⇒absentsubscriptnormsubscript𝒯𝑐𝑢𝑠𝑎subscript𝒯𝑐𝑣𝑠𝑎\displaystyle\Rightarrow||\mathcal{T}_{c}u(s,a)-\mathcal{T}_{c}v(s,a)||_{\infty}⇒ | | caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_u ( italic_s , italic_a ) - caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v ( italic_s , italic_a ) | | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∞ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤γ⋅‖us⁢(s,a)−vs⁢(s,a)‖∞absent⋅𝛾subscriptnormsubscript𝑢𝑠𝑠𝑎subscript𝑣𝑠𝑠𝑎\displaystyle\leq\gamma\cdot||u_{s}(s,a)-v_{s}(s,a)||_{\infty}≤ italic_γ ⋅ | | italic_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_a ) - italic_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_a ) | | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∞ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT (5.1.4)
  2. 2.

    Now, for us to prove the monotonicity, we have to consider two state-action value functions u𝑢uitalic_u and v𝑣vitalic_v such that u⁢(s,a)≤v⁢(s,a)⁢∀(s,a)∈𝒮×𝒜𝑢𝑠𝑎𝑣𝑠𝑎for-all𝑠𝑎𝒮𝒜u(s,a)\leq v(s,a)~{}~{}\forall(s,a)\in\mathcal{S}\times\mathcal{A}italic_u ( italic_s , italic_a ) ≤ italic_v ( italic_s , italic_a ) ∀ ( italic_s , italic_a ) ∈ caligraphic_S × caligraphic_A. From the definition we gave through the Expression 5.1.2, this also means that us⁢(s,a)≤vs⁢(s,a)subscript𝑢𝑠𝑠𝑎subscript𝑣𝑠𝑠𝑎u_{s}(s,a)\leq v_{s}(s,a)italic_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_a ) ≤ italic_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_a ). Based now on the proof we just provided for the monotonicity, we have :

    𝒯c⁢u⁢(s,a)−𝒯c⁢v⁢(s,a)subscript𝒯𝑐𝑢𝑠𝑎subscript𝒯𝑐𝑣𝑠𝑎\displaystyle\mathcal{T}_{c}u(s,a)-\mathcal{T}_{c}v(s,a)caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_u ( italic_s , italic_a ) - caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v ( italic_s , italic_a ) ≤γ⋅maxa′⁢(𝔼ℙ⁢(us⁢(s′,a′)−vs⁢(s′,a′))⏟us≤vs)absent⋅𝛾superscript𝑎′subscript𝔼ℙsubscript𝑢𝑠subscript𝑣𝑠⏟subscript𝑢𝑠superscript𝑠′superscript𝑎′subscript𝑣𝑠superscript𝑠′superscript𝑎′\displaystyle\leq\gamma\cdot\underset{a^{\prime}}{\max}~{}\left(\mathbb{E}_{% \mathbb{P}}\underset{u_{s}\leq v_{s}}{\underbrace{\left(u_{s}(s^{\prime},a^{% \prime})-v_{s}(s^{\prime},a^{\prime})\right)}}\right)≤ italic_γ ⋅ start_UNDERACCENT italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_UNDERACCENT start_ARG roman_max end_ARG ( blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_UNDERACCENT italic_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ italic_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_UNDERACCENT start_ARG under⏟ start_ARG ( italic_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) - italic_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) end_ARG end_ARG )
    ⇒𝒯c⁢u⁢(s,a)−𝒯c⁢v⁢(s,a)⇒absentsubscript𝒯𝑐𝑢𝑠𝑎subscript𝒯𝑐𝑣𝑠𝑎\displaystyle\Rightarrow\mathcal{T}_{c}u(s,a)-\mathcal{T}_{c}v(s,a)⇒ caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_u ( italic_s , italic_a ) - caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v ( italic_s , italic_a ) ≤0absent0\displaystyle\leq 0≤ 0
    ⇒𝒯c⁢u⁢(s,a)⇒absentsubscript𝒯𝑐𝑢𝑠𝑎\displaystyle\Rightarrow\mathcal{T}_{c}u(s,a)⇒ caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_u ( italic_s , italic_a ) ≤𝒯c⁢v⁢(s,a)⁢∀u,v∈𝒬formulae-sequenceabsentsubscript𝒯𝑐𝑣𝑠𝑎for-all𝑢𝑣𝒬\displaystyle\leq\mathcal{T}_{c}v(s,a)~{}~{}~{}\forall~{}u,v\in\mathcal{Q}≤ caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v ( italic_s , italic_a ) ∀ italic_u , italic_v ∈ caligraphic_Q (5.1.5)

∎

From this proof, we can conclude that 𝒯csubscript𝒯𝑐\mathcal{T}_{c}caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT has only one fixed point and that fixed point is optimal for this setup (that is the setup in which we are using the consistent Bellman equation instead of the classical one).
The question that remains is how this fixed point relates to the one we have found using the classical Bellman operator.
The most important thing is that, we are sure to converge to a unique fixed-point. As we don’t yet have the mathematical tool to say something about the relation between that fixed point and the one which will be found using the classical Bellman Operator, we can just wait and see how the operator will behave in practice in comparison to the Bellman Operator.

5.1.3 Modified Robust Stochastic Operator

Here, the proposed operator take inspirations in both the articles [23] and [8] but mostly that former article. This is more general (expectation operator) and different from the Robust Stochastic Operator suggested in [23].
We know that, as an RL algorithm get better, if we express vπ⁢(s)subscript𝑣𝜋𝑠v_{\pi}(s)italic_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s ) by :

vπ⁢(s)=∑aπ⁢(a|s)⋅qπ⁢(s,a),subscript𝑣𝜋𝑠subscript𝑎⋅𝜋conditional𝑎𝑠subscript𝑞𝜋𝑠𝑎v_{\pi}(s)=\sum_{a}\pi(a|s)\cdot q_{\pi}(s,a),italic_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s ) = ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π ( italic_a | italic_s ) ⋅ italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_a ) ,

the difference that we will call advantage learning, given by

A⁢(s,a)=qπ⁢(s,a)−vπ⁢(s),𝐴𝑠𝑎subscript𝑞𝜋𝑠𝑎subscript𝑣𝜋𝑠A(s,a)=q_{\pi}(s,a)-v_{\pi}(s),italic_A ( italic_s , italic_a ) = italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_a ) - italic_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s ) ,

always gives an idea on how well is our policy (which should be learning how to often choose better actions) as well as the value function. The quantity |A⁢(s,a)|𝐴𝑠𝑎\left|A(s,a)\right|| italic_A ( italic_s , italic_a ) | should get smaller as we are learning the good policy.
Now, let’s say we modify the Bellman Expectation Operator for the action-value function as defined by the Relation 4.3.4 in such a way that we integrate the idea of the advantage learning directly in the Bellman Operator instead of waiting applying it in the learning process as for some policy gradient methods [15]. Now, if we call that new operator 𝒯asubscript𝒯𝑎\mathcal{T}_{a}caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, it will be defined for all f∈𝒬𝑓𝒬f\in\mathcal{Q}italic_f ∈ caligraphic_Q as follows :

(𝒯a⁢f)=r⁢(s,a)+γ⋅∑s′p⁢(s′|s,a)⁢(∑a′π⁢(a′|s′)⋅f⁢(s′,a′))+β⋅[f⁢(s,a)−∑aπ⁢(a|s)⁢f⁢(s,a)]⏟A⁢(s,a)⁢: advantage learningsubscript𝒯𝑎𝑓𝑟𝑠𝑎⋅𝛾subscriptsuperscript𝑠′𝑝conditionalsuperscript𝑠′𝑠𝑎subscriptsuperscript𝑎′⋅𝜋conditionalsuperscript𝑎′superscript𝑠′𝑓superscript𝑠′superscript𝑎′⋅𝛽𝐴𝑠𝑎: advantage learning⏟delimited-[]𝑓𝑠𝑎subscript𝑎𝜋conditional𝑎𝑠𝑓𝑠𝑎\left(\mathcal{T}_{a}f\right)=r(s,a)+\gamma\cdot\sum_{s^{\prime}}p(s^{\prime}|% s,a)\left(\sum_{a^{\prime}}\pi(a^{\prime}|s^{\prime})\cdot f(s^{\prime},a^{% \prime})\right)+\beta\cdot\underset{A(s,a)\text{:~{}advantage learning}}{% \underbrace{\left[f(s,a)-\sum_{a}\pi(a|s)f(s,a)\right]}}( caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f ) = italic_r ( italic_s , italic_a ) + italic_γ ⋅ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s , italic_a ) ( ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π ( italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ⋅ italic_f ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) + italic_β ⋅ start_UNDERACCENT italic_A ( italic_s , italic_a ) : advantage learning end_UNDERACCENT start_ARG under⏟ start_ARG [ italic_f ( italic_s , italic_a ) - ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π ( italic_a | italic_s ) italic_f ( italic_s , italic_a ) ] end_ARG end_ARG (5.1.6)

We can now study the properties of the operator defined by this Expression 5.1.6. The coefficient β𝛽\betaitalic_β is any real now but we will define it properly at the end of this theoretical investigation.

5.1.4 Proposition.

The operator 𝒯asubscript𝒯𝑎\mathcal{T}_{a}caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT as defined by the Relation 5.1.6 is not a contraction mapping.

Proof.

Let u⁢(s,a)≡u𝑢𝑠𝑎𝑢u(s,a)\equiv uitalic_u ( italic_s , italic_a ) ≡ italic_u and v⁢(s,a)≡v𝑣𝑠𝑎𝑣v(s,a)\equiv vitalic_v ( italic_s , italic_a ) ≡ italic_v be two elements of 𝒬𝒬\mathcal{Q}caligraphic_Q :

|𝒯a⁢u−𝒯a⁢v|subscript𝒯𝑎𝑢subscript𝒯𝑎𝑣\displaystyle\left|\mathcal{T}_{a}u-\mathcal{T}_{a}v\right|| caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_u - caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v | =|γ𝔼ℙ(∑a′π(a′|s′)(u(s′,a′)−v(s′,a′)))+β[(u−v)−∑aπ(a|s)(u−v)]|\displaystyle=\left|\gamma\mathbb{E}_{\mathbb{P}}\left(\sum_{a^{\prime}}\pi(a^% {\prime}|s^{\prime})\left(u(s^{\prime},a^{\prime})-v(s^{\prime},a^{\prime})% \right)\right)+\beta\left[(u-v)-\sum_{a}\pi(a|s)(u-v)\right]\right|= | italic_γ blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π ( italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ( italic_u ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) - italic_v ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) ) + italic_β [ ( italic_u - italic_v ) - ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π ( italic_a | italic_s ) ( italic_u - italic_v ) ] |
>β⋅|u⁢(s,a)−v⁢(s,a)|⁢for some couples (u,v) and βabsent⋅𝛽𝑢𝑠𝑎𝑣𝑠𝑎for some couples (u,v) and β\displaystyle>\beta\cdot\Big{|}u(s,a)-v(s,a)\Big{|}~{}~{}~{}\text{for some % couples $(u,v)$~{} and ~{} $\beta$}> italic_β ⋅ | italic_u ( italic_s , italic_a ) - italic_v ( italic_s , italic_a ) | for some couples ( italic_u , italic_v ) and italic_β
⇒‖𝒯a⁢u−𝒯a⁢v‖∞⇒absentsubscriptnormsubscript𝒯𝑎𝑢subscript𝒯𝑎𝑣\displaystyle\Rightarrow||\mathcal{T}_{a}u-\mathcal{T}_{a}v||_{\infty}⇒ | | caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_u - caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v | | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∞ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT >β⋅‖u−v‖∞absent⋅𝛽subscriptnorm𝑢𝑣\displaystyle>\beta\cdot||u-v||_{\infty}> italic_β ⋅ | | italic_u - italic_v | | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∞ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT (5.1.7)

So, as we can see, whatever β𝛽\betaitalic_β will be, there exist situations where the operator 𝒯asubscript𝒯𝑎\mathcal{T}_{a}caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is not a contration. ∎

Since the operator 𝒯asubscript𝒯𝑎\mathcal{T}_{a}caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is not a contraction, we cannot assess its convergence. But, even if we are not sure about the convergence, we can still say something about its behavior. For that, inspired by the definitions given in [23, 8], let’s define two important properties that we will call the properties of a well-behaving operator. There are the optimality preservation and the gap increasing properties.
Note : in the following definitions, we’ll change a little bit our conventions by writing value functions in capital letters. This will help us to write properly operators as indices.

5.1.5 Definition (Optimality preservation).

Let call 𝒯asubscript𝒯𝑎\mathcal{T}_{a}caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT an alternative to the Bellman operator and 𝒯bsubscript𝒯𝑏\mathcal{T}_{b}caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT the classical Bellman operator. We will say that 𝒯asubscript𝒯𝑎\mathcal{T}_{a}caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT preserves the optimality property if :

Qk,𝒯b<Vk,𝒯b⇒Qk,𝒯a<Vk,𝒯awhen k→∞formulae-sequencesubscript𝑄𝑘subscript𝒯𝑏subscript𝑉𝑘subscript𝒯𝑏⇒subscript𝑄𝑘subscript𝒯𝑎subscript𝑉𝑘subscript𝒯𝑎when k→∞Q_{k,\mathcal{T}_{b}}<V_{k,\mathcal{T}_{b}}\Rightarrow Q_{k,\mathcal{T}_{a}}<V% _{k,\mathcal{T}_{a}}~{}~{}~{}~{}\text{when $k\to\infty$}italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < italic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ⇒ italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < italic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT when italic_k → ∞

Qk,𝒯subscript𝑄𝑘𝒯Q_{k,\mathcal{T}}italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT represents the action value function that we find at the iteration k𝑘kitalic_k, using the operator 𝒯𝒯\mathcal{T}caligraphic_T and Vk,𝒯subscript𝑉𝑘𝒯V_{k,\mathcal{T}}italic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT the associated state value function.

5.1.6 Definition (Gap increasing).

Using the same notation as previously, we will say that an alternative operator 𝒯asubscript𝒯𝑎\mathcal{T}_{a}caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT to the Bellman one 𝒯bsubscript𝒯𝑏\mathcal{T}_{b}caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT induces the gap increasing property if, for each state s∈𝒮𝑠𝒮s\in\mathcal{S}italic_s ∈ caligraphic_S and each feasible action in that state a∈𝒜⁢(s)𝑎𝒜𝑠a\in\mathcal{A}(s)italic_a ∈ caligraphic_A ( italic_s ) :

|limk→∞[Qk,𝒯b−Vk,𝒯b]|≤|limk→∞[Qk,𝒯a−Vk,𝒯a]|subscript→𝑘delimited-[]subscript𝑄𝑘subscript𝒯𝑏subscript𝑉𝑘subscript𝒯𝑏subscript→𝑘delimited-[]subscript𝑄𝑘subscript𝒯𝑎subscript𝑉𝑘subscript𝒯𝑎\left|\lim\limits_{k\to\infty}\left[Q_{k,\mathcal{T}_{b}}-V_{k,\mathcal{T}_{b}% }\right]\right|\leq\left|\lim\limits_{k\to\infty}\left[Q_{k,\mathcal{T}_{a}}-V% _{k,\mathcal{T}_{a}}\right]\right|| roman_lim start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k → ∞ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] | ≤ | roman_lim start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k → ∞ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] |

Knowing that at each state, Vk,𝒯subscript𝑉𝑘𝒯V_{k,\mathcal{T}}italic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is an average of all Qk,𝒯subscript𝑄𝑘𝒯Q_{k,\mathcal{T}}italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT that we can get by making a certain action from that state.

The optimality preservation and the gap increasing properties represent respectively :

  • •

    How well the operator is likely to behave while looking for the fixed point and,

  • •

    How is the model able to differentiate the values of suboptimal actions with those for optimal actions.

5.1.7 Proposition.

We claim that, the operator defined by the Expression 5.1.6, even if it is not a contraction, is both optimality preserving and gap increasing.

Proof.

Let’s prove those properties in the same order :

  1. 1.

    Optimality preservation : We know that Qk,𝒯=𝒯⁢Qk−1subscript𝑄𝑘𝒯𝒯subscript𝑄𝑘1Q_{k,\mathcal{T}}=\mathcal{T}Q_{k-1}italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = caligraphic_T italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and Vk,𝒯b=∑aπ⁢(a|s).B⁢e⁢l⁢l⁢(Qk−1)formulae-sequencesubscript𝑉𝑘subscript𝒯𝑏subscript𝑎𝜋conditional𝑎𝑠𝐵𝑒𝑙𝑙subscript𝑄𝑘1V_{k,\mathcal{T}_{b}}=\displaystyle\sum_{a}\pi(a|s).Bell(Q_{k-1})italic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π ( italic_a | italic_s ) . italic_B italic_e italic_l italic_l ( italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ). Now, using the Definition 5.1.5, we assume that Qk,𝒯b<Vk,𝒯bsubscript𝑄𝑘subscript𝒯𝑏subscript𝑉𝑘subscript𝒯𝑏Q_{k,\mathcal{T}_{b}}<V_{k,\mathcal{T}_{b}}italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < italic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and we will deduce the relation between Qk,𝒯asubscript𝑄𝑘subscript𝒯𝑎Q_{k,\mathcal{T}_{a}}italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and Vk,𝒯asubscript𝑉𝑘subscript𝒯𝑎V_{k,\mathcal{T}_{a}}italic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. To make the notation easy to manage, we will do this replacement :

    r⁢(s,a)+γ⋅𝔼ℙ⁢(∑a′π⁢(a′|s′)⋅Qk−1⁢(s′,a′))=B⁢e⁢l⁢l⁢(Qk−1)𝑟𝑠𝑎⋅𝛾subscript𝔼ℙsubscriptsuperscript𝑎′⋅𝜋conditionalsuperscript𝑎′superscript𝑠′subscript𝑄𝑘1superscript𝑠′superscript𝑎′𝐵𝑒𝑙𝑙subscript𝑄𝑘1r(s,a)+\gamma\cdot\mathbb{E}_{\mathbb{P}}\left(\sum_{a^{\prime}}\pi(a^{\prime}% |s^{\prime})\cdot Q_{k-1}(s^{\prime},a^{\prime})\right)=Bell\left(Q_{k-1}\right)italic_r ( italic_s , italic_a ) + italic_γ ⋅ blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π ( italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ⋅ italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) = italic_B italic_e italic_l italic_l ( italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT )

    Now we can start (knowing that we are working with k→∞→𝑘k\to\inftyitalic_k → ∞) :

    Qk,𝒯bsubscript𝑄𝑘subscript𝒯𝑏\displaystyle Q_{k,\mathcal{T}_{b}}italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT <Vk,𝒯babsentsubscript𝑉𝑘subscript𝒯𝑏\displaystyle<V_{k,\mathcal{T}_{b}}< italic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT
    ⇒𝒯b⁢Qk−1⇒absentsubscript𝒯𝑏subscript𝑄𝑘1\displaystyle\Rightarrow\mathcal{T}_{b}Q_{k-1}⇒ caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT <Vk,𝒯babsentsubscript𝑉𝑘subscript𝒯𝑏\displaystyle<V_{k,\mathcal{T}_{b}}< italic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT
    ⇒B⁢e⁢l⁢l⁢(Qk−1)⇒absent𝐵𝑒𝑙𝑙subscript𝑄𝑘1\displaystyle\Rightarrow Bell\left(Q_{k-1}\right)⇒ italic_B italic_e italic_l italic_l ( italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) <∑aπ⁢(a|s)⋅B⁢e⁢l⁢l⁢(Qk−1)absentsubscript𝑎⋅𝜋conditional𝑎𝑠𝐵𝑒𝑙𝑙subscript𝑄𝑘1\displaystyle<\sum_{a}\pi(a|s)\cdot Bell\left(Q_{k-1}\right)< ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π ( italic_a | italic_s ) ⋅ italic_B italic_e italic_l italic_l ( italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT )

    without a loss of generality, let K=mina⁡(Qk−1⁢(s,a)−Vk−1⁢(s))𝐾subscript𝑎subscript𝑄𝑘1𝑠𝑎subscript𝑉𝑘1𝑠K=\min_{a}{\Big{(}Q_{k-1}(s,a)-V_{k-1}(s)\Big{)}}italic_K = roman_min start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_a ) - italic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s ) ). Then

    B⁢e⁢l⁢l⁢(Qk−1)𝐵𝑒𝑙𝑙subscript𝑄𝑘1\displaystyle Bell\left(Q_{k-1}\right)italic_B italic_e italic_l italic_l ( italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) <∑aπ⁢(a|s)⋅B⁢e⁢l⁢l⁢(Qk−1)absentsubscript𝑎⋅𝜋conditional𝑎𝑠𝐵𝑒𝑙𝑙subscript𝑄𝑘1\displaystyle<\sum_{a}\pi(a|s)\cdot Bell\left(Q_{k-1}\right)< ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π ( italic_a | italic_s ) ⋅ italic_B italic_e italic_l italic_l ( italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT )
    ⇒B⁢e⁢l⁢l⁢(Qk−1)+β⋅K⇒absent𝐵𝑒𝑙𝑙subscript𝑄𝑘1⋅𝛽𝐾\displaystyle\Rightarrow Bell\left(Q_{k-1}\right)+\beta\cdot K⇒ italic_B italic_e italic_l italic_l ( italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + italic_β ⋅ italic_K <∑aπ⁢(a|s)⋅B⁢e⁢l⁢l⁢(Qk−1)+β⋅K⋅1absentsubscript𝑎⋅𝜋conditional𝑎𝑠𝐵𝑒𝑙𝑙subscript𝑄𝑘1⋅𝛽𝐾1\displaystyle<\sum_{a}\pi(a|s)\cdot Bell\left(Q_{k-1}\right)+\beta\cdot K\cdot 1< ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π ( italic_a | italic_s ) ⋅ italic_B italic_e italic_l italic_l ( italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + italic_β ⋅ italic_K ⋅ 1
    ⇒B⁢e⁢l⁢l⁢(Qk−1)+β⋅K⇒absent𝐵𝑒𝑙𝑙subscript𝑄𝑘1⋅𝛽𝐾\displaystyle\Rightarrow Bell\left(Q_{k-1}\right)+\beta\cdot K⇒ italic_B italic_e italic_l italic_l ( italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + italic_β ⋅ italic_K <∑aπ⁢(a|s)⋅B⁢e⁢l⁢l⁢(Qk−1)+β⋅K⋅∑aπ⁢(a|s)absentsubscript𝑎⋅𝜋conditional𝑎𝑠𝐵𝑒𝑙𝑙subscript𝑄𝑘1⋅𝛽𝐾subscript𝑎𝜋conditional𝑎𝑠\displaystyle<\sum_{a}\pi(a|s)\cdot Bell\left(Q_{k-1}\right)+\beta\cdot K\cdot% \sum_{a}\pi(a|s)< ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π ( italic_a | italic_s ) ⋅ italic_B italic_e italic_l italic_l ( italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + italic_β ⋅ italic_K ⋅ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π ( italic_a | italic_s )
    ⇒B⁢e⁢l⁢l⁢(Qk−1)+β⋅K⇒absent𝐵𝑒𝑙𝑙subscript𝑄𝑘1⋅𝛽𝐾\displaystyle\Rightarrow Bell\left(Q_{k-1}\right)+\beta\cdot K⇒ italic_B italic_e italic_l italic_l ( italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + italic_β ⋅ italic_K <∑aπ⁢(a|s)⋅B⁢e⁢l⁢l⁢(Qk−1)+β⋅∑aπ⁢(a|s)⋅Kabsentsubscript𝑎⋅𝜋conditional𝑎𝑠𝐵𝑒𝑙𝑙subscript𝑄𝑘1⋅𝛽subscript𝑎⋅𝜋conditional𝑎𝑠𝐾\displaystyle<\sum_{a}\pi(a|s)\cdot Bell\left(Q_{k-1}\right)+\beta\cdot\sum_{a% }\pi(a|s)\cdot K< ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π ( italic_a | italic_s ) ⋅ italic_B italic_e italic_l italic_l ( italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + italic_β ⋅ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π ( italic_a | italic_s ) ⋅ italic_K

    we know that K≤∑aπ⁢(a|s)⋅(Qk−1⁢(s,a)−Vk−1⁢(s))⁢∀(s,a)∈𝒮×𝒜𝐾subscript𝑎⋅𝜋conditional𝑎𝑠subscript𝑄𝑘1𝑠𝑎subscript𝑉𝑘1𝑠for-all𝑠𝑎𝒮𝒜K\leq\sum_{a}\pi(a|s)\cdot\left(Q_{k-1}(s,a)-V_{k-1}(s)\right)~{}~{}\forall~{}% (s,a)\in\mathcal{S}\times\mathcal{A}italic_K ≤ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π ( italic_a | italic_s ) ⋅ ( italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_a ) - italic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s ) ) ∀ ( italic_s , italic_a ) ∈ caligraphic_S × caligraphic_A, and when k→∞→𝑘k\to\inftyitalic_k → ∞ as we are getting better policy, we have almost surely that (Qk−1−Vk−1)≤∑aπ⁢(a|s)⋅(Qk−1−Vk−1)subscript𝑄𝑘1subscript𝑉𝑘1subscript𝑎⋅𝜋conditional𝑎𝑠subscript𝑄𝑘1subscript𝑉𝑘1\left(Q_{k-1}-V_{k-1}\right)\leq\sum_{a}\pi(a|s)\cdot\left(Q_{k-1}-V_{k-1}\right)( italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ≤ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π ( italic_a | italic_s ) ⋅ ( italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT )

    B⁢e⁢l⁢l⁢(Qk−1)+β⋅K𝐵𝑒𝑙𝑙subscript𝑄𝑘1⋅𝛽𝐾\displaystyle Bell\left(Q_{k-1}\right)+\beta\cdot Kitalic_B italic_e italic_l italic_l ( italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + italic_β ⋅ italic_K <∑aπ⁢(a|s)⋅B⁢e⁢l⁢l⁢(Qk−1)+β⋅∑aπ⁢(a|s)⋅Kabsentsubscript𝑎⋅𝜋conditional𝑎𝑠𝐵𝑒𝑙𝑙subscript𝑄𝑘1⋅𝛽subscript𝑎⋅𝜋conditional𝑎𝑠𝐾\displaystyle<\sum_{a}\pi(a|s)\cdot Bell\left(Q_{k-1}\right)+\beta\cdot\sum_{a% }\pi(a|s)\cdot K< ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π ( italic_a | italic_s ) ⋅ italic_B italic_e italic_l italic_l ( italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + italic_β ⋅ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π ( italic_a | italic_s ) ⋅ italic_K
    ⇒B⁢e⁢l⁢l⁢(Qk−1)+β⋅(Qk−1−Vk−1)⇒absent𝐵𝑒𝑙𝑙subscript𝑄𝑘1⋅𝛽subscript𝑄𝑘1subscript𝑉𝑘1\displaystyle\Rightarrow Bell\left(Q_{k-1}\right)+\beta\cdot\left(Q_{k-1}-V_{k% -1}\right)⇒ italic_B italic_e italic_l italic_l ( italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + italic_β ⋅ ( italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) <∑aπ⁢(a|s)⋅B⁢e⁢l⁢l⁢(Qk−1)+β⋅∑aπ⁢(a|s)⋅(Qk−1−Vk−1)absentsubscript𝑎⋅𝜋conditional𝑎𝑠𝐵𝑒𝑙𝑙subscript𝑄𝑘1⋅𝛽subscript𝑎⋅𝜋conditional𝑎𝑠subscript𝑄𝑘1subscript𝑉𝑘1\displaystyle<\sum_{a}\pi(a|s)\cdot Bell\left(Q_{k-1}\right)+\beta\cdot\sum_{a% }\pi(a|s)\cdot\left(Q_{k-1}-V_{k-1}\right)< ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π ( italic_a | italic_s ) ⋅ italic_B italic_e italic_l italic_l ( italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + italic_β ⋅ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π ( italic_a | italic_s ) ⋅ ( italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT )
    ⇒B⁢e⁢l⁢l⁢(Qk−1)+β⋅(Qk−1−Vk−1)⏟Qk,𝒯a⇒absentsubscript𝑄𝑘subscript𝒯𝑎⏟𝐵𝑒𝑙𝑙subscript𝑄𝑘1⋅𝛽subscript𝑄𝑘1subscript𝑉𝑘1\displaystyle\Rightarrow\underset{Q_{k,\mathcal{T}_{a}}}{\underbrace{Bell\left% (Q_{k-1}\right)+\beta\cdot\left(Q_{k-1}-V_{k-1}\right)}}⇒ start_UNDERACCENT italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_UNDERACCENT start_ARG under⏟ start_ARG italic_B italic_e italic_l italic_l ( italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + italic_β ⋅ ( italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG end_ARG <∑aπ⁢(a|s)⋅[B⁢e⁢l⁢l⁢(Qk−1)+β⋅(Qk−1−Vk−1)]absentsubscript𝑎⋅𝜋conditional𝑎𝑠delimited-[]𝐵𝑒𝑙𝑙subscript𝑄𝑘1⋅𝛽subscript𝑄𝑘1subscript𝑉𝑘1\displaystyle<\sum_{a}\pi(a|s)\cdot\Big{[}Bell\left(Q_{k-1}\right)+\beta\cdot% \left(Q_{k-1}-V_{k-1}\right)\Big{]}< ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π ( italic_a | italic_s ) ⋅ [ italic_B italic_e italic_l italic_l ( italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + italic_β ⋅ ( italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ]
    ⇒Qk,𝒯a⇒absentsubscript𝑄𝑘subscript𝒯𝑎\displaystyle\Rightarrow Q_{k,\mathcal{T}_{a}}⇒ italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT <∑aπ⁢(a|s)⋅Qk,𝒯a⁢(s,a)absentsubscript𝑎⋅𝜋conditional𝑎𝑠subscript𝑄𝑘subscript𝒯𝑎𝑠𝑎\displaystyle<\sum_{a}\pi(a|s)\cdot Q_{k,\mathcal{T}_{a}}(s,a)< ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π ( italic_a | italic_s ) ⋅ italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_a )
    ⇒Qk,𝒯a⇒absentsubscript𝑄𝑘subscript𝒯𝑎\displaystyle\Rightarrow Q_{k,\mathcal{T}_{a}}⇒ italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT <Vk,𝒯aas k→∞absentsubscript𝑉𝑘subscript𝒯𝑎as k→∞\displaystyle<V_{k,\mathcal{T}_{a}}~{}~{}~{}~{}~{}~{}~{}~{}~{}\text{as $k\to% \infty$}< italic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT as italic_k → ∞ (5.1.8)
  2. 2.

    Gap increasing : Using the Definition 5.1.6, we have now to show that :

    |limk→∞[Qk,𝒯b−Vk,𝒯b]|≤|limk→∞[Qk,𝒯a−Vk,𝒯a]|subscript→𝑘delimited-[]subscript𝑄𝑘subscript𝒯𝑏subscript𝑉𝑘subscript𝒯𝑏subscript→𝑘delimited-[]subscript𝑄𝑘subscript𝒯𝑎subscript𝑉𝑘subscript𝒯𝑎\left|\lim\limits_{k\to\infty}\left[Q_{k,\mathcal{T}_{b}}-V_{k,\mathcal{T}_{b}% }\right]\right|\leq\left|\lim\limits_{k\to\infty}\left[Q_{k,\mathcal{T}_{a}}-V% _{k,\mathcal{T}_{a}}\right]\right|| roman_lim start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k → ∞ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] | ≤ | roman_lim start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k → ∞ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] |

    In fact, we know that, using the Bellman Operator 𝒯bsubscript𝒯𝑏\mathcal{T}_{b}caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, if we are improving the policy at the same time, the state value function Vk,𝒯bsubscript𝑉𝑘subscript𝒯𝑏V_{k,\mathcal{T}_{b}}italic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT will converge to the action value function Qk,𝒯bsubscript𝑄𝑘subscript𝒯𝑏Q_{k,\mathcal{T}_{b}}italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT as the policy get better. So, for optimal actions we will have :

    limk→∞[Qk,𝒯b−Vk,𝒯b]=0,subscript→𝑘delimited-[]subscript𝑄𝑘subscript𝒯𝑏subscript𝑉𝑘subscript𝒯𝑏0\lim\limits_{k\to\infty}\left[Q_{k,\mathcal{T}_{b}}-V_{k,\mathcal{T}_{b}}% \right]=0,roman_lim start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k → ∞ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] = 0 ,

    i.e. also using 𝒯asubscript𝒯𝑎\mathcal{T}_{a}caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, we can say surely for optimal actions :

    |limk→∞[Qk,𝒯b−Vk,𝒯b]|=0≤|limk→∞[Qk,𝒯a−Vk,𝒯a]|subscript→𝑘delimited-[]subscript𝑄𝑘subscript𝒯𝑏subscript𝑉𝑘subscript𝒯𝑏0subscript→𝑘delimited-[]subscript𝑄𝑘subscript𝒯𝑎subscript𝑉𝑘subscript𝒯𝑎\left|\lim\limits_{k\to\infty}\left[Q_{k,\mathcal{T}_{b}}-V_{k,\mathcal{T}_{b}% }\right]\right|=0~{}~{}~{}~{}\leq~{}~{}~{}~{}\left|\lim\limits_{k\to\infty}% \left[Q_{k,\mathcal{T}_{a}}-V_{k,\mathcal{T}_{a}}\right]\right|| roman_lim start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k → ∞ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] | = 0 ≤ | roman_lim start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k → ∞ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] |

    For other actions, the inequality also holds because on convergence (Qk−1−Vk−1)<0subscript𝑄𝑘1subscript𝑉𝑘10\left(Q_{k-1}-V_{k-1}\right)<0( italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) < 0 almost surely and from the proof of optimality preservation we have seen that :

    B⁢e⁢l⁢l⁢(Qk−1)+β⋅(Qk−1−Vk−1)<∑aπ⁢(a|s)⋅B⁢e⁢l⁢l⁢(Qk−1)+β⋅∑aπ⁢(a|s)⋅(Qk−1−Vk−1),𝐵𝑒𝑙𝑙subscript𝑄𝑘1⋅𝛽subscript𝑄𝑘1subscript𝑉𝑘1subscript𝑎⋅𝜋conditional𝑎𝑠𝐵𝑒𝑙𝑙subscript𝑄𝑘1⋅𝛽subscript𝑎⋅𝜋conditional𝑎𝑠subscript𝑄𝑘1subscript𝑉𝑘1Bell\left(Q_{k-1}\right)+\beta\cdot\left(Q_{k-1}-V_{k-1}\right)<\sum_{a}\pi(a|% s)\cdot Bell\left(Q_{k-1}\right)+\beta\cdot\sum_{a}\pi(a|s)\cdot\left(Q_{k-1}-% V_{k-1}\right),italic_B italic_e italic_l italic_l ( italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + italic_β ⋅ ( italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) < ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π ( italic_a | italic_s ) ⋅ italic_B italic_e italic_l italic_l ( italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + italic_β ⋅ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π ( italic_a | italic_s ) ⋅ ( italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , i.e. also |limk→∞[Qk,𝒯b−Vk,𝒯b]|≤|limk→∞[Qk,𝒯a−Vk,𝒯a]|subscript→𝑘delimited-[]subscript𝑄𝑘subscript𝒯𝑏subscript𝑉𝑘subscript𝒯𝑏subscript→𝑘delimited-[]subscript𝑄𝑘subscript𝒯𝑎subscript𝑉𝑘subscript𝒯𝑎\left|\lim\limits_{k\to\infty}\left[Q_{k,\mathcal{T}_{b}}-V_{k,\mathcal{T}_{b}% }\right]\right|\leq\left|\lim\limits_{k\to\infty}\left[Q_{k,\mathcal{T}_{a}}-V% _{k,\mathcal{T}_{a}}\right]\right|| roman_lim start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k → ∞ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] | ≤ | roman_lim start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k → ∞ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] | for any (s,a)∈𝒮×𝒜𝑠𝑎𝒮𝒜(s,a)\in\mathcal{S}\times\mathcal{A}( italic_s , italic_a ) ∈ caligraphic_S × caligraphic_A.

∎

So, the operator that we suggested through the Expression 5.1.6 is a well behaving operator, even if we just assume the convergence (modulo the value of β𝛽\betaitalic_β).
Let us now give some comments about the possibility of finding a fixed point for this operator. But, before doing so, we can first say something about the continuity and the boundedness of that operator because without that, we cannot talk about fixed points.

5.1.8 Proposition.

Let r⁢(s,a)𝑟𝑠𝑎r(s,a)italic_r ( italic_s , italic_a ), the reward function, be bounded and continuous. The operator 𝒯asubscript𝒯𝑎\mathcal{T}_{a}caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT as defined by the Expression 5.1.6, will also be bounded and continuous.

Proof.

We can split our operator in three parts for simplicity :

(𝒯a⁢f)=r⁢(s,a)⏟part 1+γ⋅∑s′p⁢(s′|s,a)⁢(∑a′π⁢(a′|s′)⋅f⁢(s′,a′))⏟part 2+β⋅[f⁢(s,a)−∑aπ⁢(a|s)⁢f⁢(s,a)]⏟A⁢(s,a)⁢: advantage learning :: part 3subscript𝒯𝑎𝑓part 1⏟𝑟𝑠𝑎part 2⏟⋅𝛾subscriptsuperscript𝑠′𝑝conditionalsuperscript𝑠′𝑠𝑎subscriptsuperscript𝑎′⋅𝜋conditionalsuperscript𝑎′superscript𝑠′𝑓superscript𝑠′superscript𝑎′𝐴𝑠𝑎: advantage learning :: part 3⏟⋅𝛽delimited-[]𝑓𝑠𝑎subscript𝑎𝜋conditional𝑎𝑠𝑓𝑠𝑎\left(\mathcal{T}_{a}f\right)=\underset{\text{part 1}}{\underbrace{r(s,a)}}+% \underset{\text{part 2}}{\underbrace{\gamma\cdot\sum_{s^{\prime}}p(s^{\prime}|% s,a)\left(\sum_{a^{\prime}}\pi(a^{\prime}|s^{\prime})\cdot f(s^{\prime},a^{% \prime})\right)}}+\underset{A(s,a)\text{:~{}advantage learning :: part 3}}{% \underbrace{\beta\cdot\left[f(s,a)-\sum_{a}\pi(a|s)f(s,a)\right]}}( caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f ) = underpart 1 start_ARG under⏟ start_ARG italic_r ( italic_s , italic_a ) end_ARG end_ARG + underpart 2 start_ARG under⏟ start_ARG italic_γ ⋅ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s , italic_a ) ( ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π ( italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ⋅ italic_f ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) end_ARG end_ARG + start_UNDERACCENT italic_A ( italic_s , italic_a ) : advantage learning :: part 3 end_UNDERACCENT start_ARG under⏟ start_ARG italic_β ⋅ [ italic_f ( italic_s , italic_a ) - ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π ( italic_a | italic_s ) italic_f ( italic_s , italic_a ) ] end_ARG end_ARG
  1. 1.

    Part 1 : the reward function is assumed to be continuous and bounded.

  2. 2.

    Part 2 : If we take that part as an operator by itself, it will be bounded (because it is a contraction) and also linear. And being a bounded linear operator implies that it is also continuous. So, if we call this new operator 𝒯s⁢m⁢a⁢l⁢lsubscript𝒯𝑠𝑚𝑎𝑙𝑙\mathcal{T}_{small}caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s italic_m italic_a italic_l italic_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT written as follows :

    (𝒯s⁢m⁢a⁢l⁢l⁢f)⁢(s,a)=γ⋅∑s′p⁢(s′|s,a)⁢(∑a′π⁢(a′|s′)⋅f⁢(s′,a′))=γ⋅𝔼ℙ⁢(∑a′π⁢(a′|s′)⋅f⁢(s′,a′)),subscript𝒯𝑠𝑚𝑎𝑙𝑙𝑓𝑠𝑎⋅𝛾subscriptsuperscript𝑠′𝑝conditionalsuperscript𝑠′𝑠𝑎subscriptsuperscript𝑎′⋅𝜋conditionalsuperscript𝑎′superscript𝑠′𝑓superscript𝑠′superscript𝑎′⋅𝛾subscript𝔼ℙsubscriptsuperscript𝑎′⋅𝜋conditionalsuperscript𝑎′superscript𝑠′𝑓superscript𝑠′superscript𝑎′\Big{(}\mathcal{T}_{small}f\Big{)}(s,a)=\gamma\cdot\sum_{s^{\prime}}p(s^{% \prime}|s,a)\left(\sum_{a^{\prime}}\pi(a^{\prime}|s^{\prime})\cdot f(s^{\prime% },a^{\prime})\right)=\gamma\cdot\mathbb{E}_{\mathbb{P}}\left(\sum_{a^{\prime}}% \pi(a^{\prime}|s^{\prime})\cdot f(s^{\prime},a^{\prime})\right),( caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s italic_m italic_a italic_l italic_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f ) ( italic_s , italic_a ) = italic_γ ⋅ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s , italic_a ) ( ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π ( italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ⋅ italic_f ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) = italic_γ ⋅ blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π ( italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ⋅ italic_f ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) ,

    We can firstly prove the linearity, assuming that u,v∈𝒬𝑢𝑣𝒬u,v\in\mathcal{Q}italic_u , italic_v ∈ caligraphic_Q and α,β∈ℝ𝛼𝛽ℝ\alpha,\beta\in\mathbb{R}italic_α , italic_β ∈ blackboard_R. We have to show that

    𝒯s⁢m⁢a⁢l⁢l⁢(α⋅u+β⋅v)=α⋅𝒯s⁢m⁢a⁢l⁢l⁢u+β⋅𝒯s⁢m⁢a⁢l⁢l⁢vsubscript𝒯𝑠𝑚𝑎𝑙𝑙⋅𝛼𝑢⋅𝛽𝑣⋅𝛼subscript𝒯𝑠𝑚𝑎𝑙𝑙𝑢⋅𝛽subscript𝒯𝑠𝑚𝑎𝑙𝑙𝑣\mathcal{T}_{small}\Big{(}\alpha\cdot u+\beta\cdot v\Big{)}=\alpha\cdot% \mathcal{T}_{small}~{}u+\beta\cdot\mathcal{T}_{small}~{}vcaligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s italic_m italic_a italic_l italic_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_α ⋅ italic_u + italic_β ⋅ italic_v ) = italic_α ⋅ caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s italic_m italic_a italic_l italic_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_u + italic_β ⋅ caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s italic_m italic_a italic_l italic_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v

    And, that is true because the operator is just formed with average operations, which are in fact linear. So, 𝒯s⁢m⁢a⁢l⁢lsubscript𝒯𝑠𝑚𝑎𝑙𝑙\mathcal{T}_{small}caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s italic_m italic_a italic_l italic_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is linear.
    Let’s now prove the contraction. For that, using again u𝑢uitalic_u and v𝑣vitalic_v defined previously, we have :

    |𝒯s⁢m⁢a⁢l⁢l⁢u−𝒯s⁢m⁢a⁢l⁢l⁢v|subscript𝒯𝑠𝑚𝑎𝑙𝑙𝑢subscript𝒯𝑠𝑚𝑎𝑙𝑙𝑣\displaystyle\Big{|}\mathcal{T}_{small}~{}u-\mathcal{T}_{small}~{}v\Big{|}| caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s italic_m italic_a italic_l italic_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_u - caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s italic_m italic_a italic_l italic_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v | =|γ⋅𝔼ℙ∑a′π(a′|s′)⋅(u(s′,a′)−v(s′,a′))|\displaystyle=\Big{|}\gamma\cdot\mathbb{E}_{\mathbb{P}}\sum_{a^{\prime}}\pi(a^% {\prime}|s^{\prime})\cdot\left(u(s^{\prime},a^{\prime})-v(s^{\prime},a^{\prime% })\right)\Big{|}= | italic_γ ⋅ blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π ( italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ⋅ ( italic_u ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) - italic_v ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) |
    ≤γ⋅𝔼ℙ|∑a′π(a′|s′)⋅(u(s′,a′)−v(s′,a′))|\displaystyle\leq\gamma\cdot\mathbb{E}_{\mathbb{P}}\Big{|}\sum_{a^{\prime}}\pi% (a^{\prime}|s^{\prime})\cdot\left(u(s^{\prime},a^{\prime})-v(s^{\prime},a^{% \prime})\right)\Big{|}≤ italic_γ ⋅ blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π ( italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ⋅ ( italic_u ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) - italic_v ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) |
    ≤γ⋅𝔼ℙ⁢∑a′π⁢(a′|s′)⋅|(u⁢(s′,a′)−v⁢(s′,a′))|absent⋅𝛾subscript𝔼ℙsubscriptsuperscript𝑎′⋅𝜋conditionalsuperscript𝑎′superscript𝑠′𝑢superscript𝑠′superscript𝑎′𝑣superscript𝑠′superscript𝑎′\displaystyle\leq\gamma\cdot\mathbb{E}_{\mathbb{P}}\sum_{a^{\prime}}\pi(a^{% \prime}|s^{\prime})\cdot\Big{|}\left(u(s^{\prime},a^{\prime})-v(s^{\prime},a^{% \prime})\right)\Big{|}≤ italic_γ ⋅ blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π ( italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ⋅ | ( italic_u ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) - italic_v ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) |
    ≤γ⋅maxs′,a′⁢|(u⁢(s′,a′)−v⁢(s′,a′))|absent⋅𝛾superscript𝑠′superscript𝑎′𝑢superscript𝑠′superscript𝑎′𝑣superscript𝑠′superscript𝑎′\displaystyle\leq\gamma\cdot\underset{s^{\prime},a^{\prime}}{\max}\Big{|}\left% (u(s^{\prime},a^{\prime})-v(s^{\prime},a^{\prime})\right)\Big{|}≤ italic_γ ⋅ start_UNDERACCENT italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_UNDERACCENT start_ARG roman_max end_ARG | ( italic_u ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) - italic_v ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) |
    =γ⋅maxs,a⁢|(u⁢(s,a)−v⁢(s,a))|absent⋅𝛾𝑠𝑎𝑢𝑠𝑎𝑣𝑠𝑎\displaystyle=\gamma\cdot\underset{s,a}{\max}\Big{|}\left(u(s,a)-v(s,a)\right)% \Big{|}= italic_γ ⋅ start_UNDERACCENT italic_s , italic_a end_UNDERACCENT start_ARG roman_max end_ARG | ( italic_u ( italic_s , italic_a ) - italic_v ( italic_s , italic_a ) ) |
    ⇒|𝒯s⁢m⁢a⁢l⁢l⁢u−𝒯s⁢m⁢a⁢l⁢l⁢v|⇒absentsubscript𝒯𝑠𝑚𝑎𝑙𝑙𝑢subscript𝒯𝑠𝑚𝑎𝑙𝑙𝑣\displaystyle\Rightarrow\Big{|}\mathcal{T}_{small}~{}u-\mathcal{T}_{small}~{}v% \Big{|}⇒ | caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s italic_m italic_a italic_l italic_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_u - caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s italic_m italic_a italic_l italic_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v | ≤γ⋅maxs,a⁢|(u⁢(s,a)−v⁢(s,a))|absent⋅𝛾𝑠𝑎𝑢𝑠𝑎𝑣𝑠𝑎\displaystyle\leq\gamma\cdot\underset{s,a}{\max}\Big{|}\left(u(s,a)-v(s,a)% \right)\Big{|}≤ italic_γ ⋅ start_UNDERACCENT italic_s , italic_a end_UNDERACCENT start_ARG roman_max end_ARG | ( italic_u ( italic_s , italic_a ) - italic_v ( italic_s , italic_a ) ) |
    ⇒maxs,a⁢|𝒯s⁢m⁢a⁢l⁢l⁢u−𝒯s⁢m⁢a⁢l⁢l⁢v|⇒absent𝑠𝑎subscript𝒯𝑠𝑚𝑎𝑙𝑙𝑢subscript𝒯𝑠𝑚𝑎𝑙𝑙𝑣\displaystyle\Rightarrow\underset{s,a}{\max}\Big{|}\mathcal{T}_{small}~{}u-% \mathcal{T}_{small}~{}v\Big{|}⇒ start_UNDERACCENT italic_s , italic_a end_UNDERACCENT start_ARG roman_max end_ARG | caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s italic_m italic_a italic_l italic_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_u - caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s italic_m italic_a italic_l italic_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v | ≤γ⋅maxs,a⁢|(u⁢(s,a)−v⁢(s,a))|absent⋅𝛾𝑠𝑎𝑢𝑠𝑎𝑣𝑠𝑎\displaystyle\leq\gamma\cdot\underset{s,a}{\max}\Big{|}\left(u(s,a)-v(s,a)% \right)\Big{|}≤ italic_γ ⋅ start_UNDERACCENT italic_s , italic_a end_UNDERACCENT start_ARG roman_max end_ARG | ( italic_u ( italic_s , italic_a ) - italic_v ( italic_s , italic_a ) ) |
    ⇒‖𝒯s⁢m⁢a⁢l⁢l⁢u−𝒯s⁢m⁢a⁢l⁢l⁢v‖∞⇒absentsubscriptnormsubscript𝒯𝑠𝑚𝑎𝑙𝑙𝑢subscript𝒯𝑠𝑚𝑎𝑙𝑙𝑣\displaystyle\Rightarrow||\mathcal{T}_{small}~{}u-\mathcal{T}_{small}~{}v||_{\infty}⇒ | | caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s italic_m italic_a italic_l italic_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_u - caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s italic_m italic_a italic_l italic_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v | | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∞ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤γ⋅‖(u⁢(s,a)−v⁢(s,a))‖∞absent⋅𝛾subscriptnorm𝑢𝑠𝑎𝑣𝑠𝑎\displaystyle\leq\gamma\cdot||\left(u(s,a)-v(s,a)\right)||_{\infty}≤ italic_γ ⋅ | | ( italic_u ( italic_s , italic_a ) - italic_v ( italic_s , italic_a ) ) | | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∞ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT (5.1.9)

    Thus, the second part is also continuous and bounded.

  3. 3.

    Part 3 : We know that, if f𝑓fitalic_f is continuous and bounded, then f⁢(s,a)−∑aπ⁢(a|s)⁢f⁢(s,a)𝑓𝑠𝑎subscript𝑎𝜋conditional𝑎𝑠𝑓𝑠𝑎f(s,a)-\sum_{a}\pi(a|s)f(s,a)italic_f ( italic_s , italic_a ) - ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π ( italic_a | italic_s ) italic_f ( italic_s , italic_a ) will also be continuous and bounded. We just need to ensure that β𝛽\betaitalic_β has good properties, ensuring convergence.

Finally, knowing that the summation of continuous and bounded operators is also continuous and bounded, we have proved the assertion, and 𝒯asubscript𝒯𝑎\mathcal{T}_{a}caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is continuous and bounded (the notion of good behavior for β𝛽\betaitalic_β is just to be precised). ∎

From the fact that 𝒯asubscript𝒯𝑎\mathcal{T}_{a}caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is continuous and bounded (modulo the behavior of β𝛽\betaitalic_β), we are sure that it will not diverge if we set well the values of β𝛽\betaitalic_β. And, looking carefully on that operator, we can now say something about β𝛽\betaitalic_β.
We will always need an operator which is well behaving (improving speed and optimality) but also close enough to the classical Bellman Operator as we are evolving. That is the only way we can ensure that we will get closer enough to the same fixed point while maintaining some nice properties of this alternative operator.
If now we consider a family of operators based on 𝒯asubscript𝒯𝑎\mathcal{T}_{a}caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT by varying β𝛽\betaitalic_β, and the case of a β𝛽\betaitalic_β which changes per iteration in one operator during the learning process, to ensure convergence, they should fulfill the following conditions :

{∑j=1∞βi,j<∞{βi,j}→0⁢with j fixed.⁢i : the operator, j : iterationcasessuperscriptsubscript𝑗1subscript𝛽𝑖𝑗missing-subexpressionmissing-subexpressionmissing-subexpressionsubscript𝛽𝑖𝑗→0with j fixed.i : the operator, j : iteration\left\{\begin{array}[]{lcl}\sum\limits_{j=1}^{\infty}\beta_{i,j}&<&\infty\\ &&\\ \{\beta_{i,j}\}&\to&0~{}~{}~{}\text{with $j$ fixed.}\end{array}\right.~{}~{}% \text{$i$ : the operator,~{}~{} $j$ : iteration}{ start_ARRAY start_ROW start_CELL ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∞ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_β start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i , italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_CELL start_CELL < end_CELL start_CELL ∞ end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL end_CELL start_CELL end_CELL start_CELL end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL { italic_β start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i , italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } end_CELL start_CELL → end_CELL start_CELL 0 with italic_j fixed. end_CELL end_ROW end_ARRAY italic_i : the operator, italic_j : iteration (5.1.10)

For an operator which has a varying β𝛽\betaitalic_β across training, as it will be applied iteratively, we can directly notice that after many iterations, we will have some terms like this

∑βi,j⋅(u⁢(s,a)−v⁢(s,a))j≡∑βi,j⋅Aj,⋅subscript𝛽𝑖𝑗subscript𝑢𝑠𝑎𝑣𝑠𝑎𝑗⋅subscript𝛽𝑖𝑗subscript𝐴𝑗\sum\beta_{i,j}\cdot\left(u(s,a)-v(s,a)\right)_{j}\equiv\sum\beta_{i,j}\cdot A% _{j},∑ italic_β start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i , italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ⋅ ( italic_u ( italic_s , italic_a ) - italic_v ( italic_s , italic_a ) ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≡ ∑ italic_β start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i , italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ⋅ italic_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ,
